title: 15pc dividend distribution
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Bank Rakyat Group declared a dividend distribution of 15 per cent, totaling RM424.62 million for the financial year ending on December 31, 2023 (FY23).The banking firm reported a 3.80 per cent growth in profit before tax and zakat (PBTZ) to RM1.76 ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Bank Rakyat Group declared a dividend distribution of 15 per cent, totaling RM424.62 million for the financial year ending on December 31, 2023 (FY23).

The banking firm reported a 3.80 per cent growth in profit before tax and zakat (PBTZ) to RM1.76 billion for FY23 from RM1.70 billion the year before.

Bank Rakyat attributed this growth to its robust fundamentals and focused efforts on its core activities.

The group said in a statement yesterday that it remained watchful despite challenges in the bankin

title: e-Sepakat system detects 47 issues on 3R in 1Q2024, says Aaron
summary: The e-Sepakat system detected a total of 47 issues related to 3R (religion, race and royalty) in the first quarter of this year (1Q2024), compared to 21 issues in the same period last year, said National Unity Minister Datuk Aaron Ago Dagang.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (April 6): The e-Sepakat system detected a total of 47 issues related to 3R (religion, race and royalty) in the first quarter of this year (1Q2024), compared to 21 issues in the same period last year, said National Unity Minister Datuk Aaron Ago Dagang.

In a statement on Saturday, Aaron said issues involving religion, statements mixed with hatred and racism showed an increase of 123%.

He said 1,454 3R-related contents were taken down from social media

title: MRT Putrajaya line women's coach service to begin Monday
summary: The women’s coach service for the Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) Putrajaya line will begin this Monday, Rapid Rail Sdn Bhd chief executive officer Amir Hamdan said.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 6): The women’s coach service for the Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) Putrajaya line will begin this Monday, Rapid Rail Sdn Bhd chief executive officer Amir Hamdan said.

The initiative will ensure more comfortable and safe journeys for women passengers, who make up 60% of rail passengers, and is a continuation of the pioneer MRT Kajang line women’s coach service that began on Sept 18 last year.

Amir said special pink stickers have been installed at

title: Avoid consuming mussels, clams for time being — Aminuddin
summary: People in the state are advised against consuming mussels, clams and other bivalves, especially from Port Dickson waters for the time being, said Menteri Besar Datuk Seri Aminuddin Harun.
content:
SEREMBAN (April 6): People in the state are advised against consuming mussels, clams and other bivalves, especially from Port Dickson waters for the time being, said Menteri Besar Datuk Seri Aminuddin Harun.

He said that this was due to the state Department of Fisheries (DOF) still conducting observations and analyses of water and bivalves in the areas.

“We used to hear about food poisoning involving mussels and clams, but it has not occurred for a long time. Ho

title: Chow: Elevated expressway, water projects at discussion stage by federal government
summary: The Juru-Sungai Dua Elevated Expressway Project and the Perak-Penang Water Project are currently at the discussion stage involving various federal government ministries, said Chief Minister Chow Kon Yeow.
content:
GEORGE TOWN (April  6): The Juru-Sungai Dua Elevated Expressway Project and the Perak-Penang Water Project are currently at the discussion stage involving various federal government ministries, said Chief Minister Chow Kon Yeow.

He hoped both projects could be implemented due to the situation in the state and that the matter was raised at a briefing on Penang’s Development, chaired by Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim at Komtar during his one-day visit to the state on Friday.

title: Police nab eight more individuals suspected of links with arrested Israeli
summary: The police have detained eight more individuals, including three foreigners, in separate operations conducted in both the city and Johor on Thursday and Friday (April 4 and 5) to facilitate the investigation into an Israeli national who was arrested with six firearms at a hotel in Ampang on March 27.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 6): The police have detained eight more individuals, including three foreigners, in separate operations conducted in both the city and Johor on Thursday and Friday (April 4 and 5) to facilitate the investigation into an Israeli national who was arrested with six firearms at a hotel in Ampang on March 27.

Inspector-General of Police Tan Sri Razarudin Husain stated that the detainees comprised five local men, two Turkish nationals, and one Georgian man, aged between 29 and 60, adding that the

title: IGP: Investigation paper on Muhammad Akmal will be submitted to AGC next week
summary: The investigation paper (IP) involving Umno Youth chief Dr Muhamad Akmal Saleh in connection with the recent controversy involving the sale of socks bearing the word ‘Allah’ is expected to be completed within five days before being submitted to the Attorney General's Chambers (AGC) for further action.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 6): The investigation paper (IP) involving Umno Youth chief Dr Muhamad Akmal Saleh in connection with the recent controversy involving the sale of socks bearing the word ‘Allah’ is expected to be completed within five days before being submitted to the Attorney General's Chambers (AGC) for further action.

Inspector General of Police Tan Sri Razarudin Husain said the police had recorded Muhamad Akmal's statement on Friday, and the investigation paper is being completed before being submitted

title: Innovate or evaporate
summary: TO those that knew him, Gerald Miranda’s Corporate motto was ‘Innovate or Evaporate’.
content:
TO those that knew him, Gerald Miranda’s Corporate motto was ‘Innovate or Evaporate’.

It has been over a month since industry icon, Gerald Miranda, Founder of Invictus Blue- Asia’s first media agency and one of Malaysia’s most prominent media brands, passed away.

His son, Keith Miranda, assumes the role of President of Invictus Blue Group. The Harvard Educated Chartered Accountant is approaching his new role with drive and clarity.

On where the industry is at the

title: On-the-spot compound to be issued to those who litter from vehicles — ministry
summary: The Ministry of Housing and Local Government (KPKT) has instructed the local authorities (PBT) to immediately issue compounds to individuals who throw thrash out of their vehicles.
content:
IPOH (April 6): The Ministry of Housing and Local Government (KPKT) has instructed the local authorities (PBT) to immediately issue compounds to individuals who throw thrash out of their vehicles.

Its minister Nga Kor Ming said the move was taken after several photos went viral showing piles of rubbish scattered on the side of the road which caused local authorities’ workers to do cleaning work.

“PBT will issue a compound and make sure the individuals pay. Stric

title: Singapore restricts sale, supply of Port Dickson mussels
summary: Singapore is restricting any supply and sale of mussels from Port Dickson, Malaysia, that are contaminated by biotoxins and are not safe for consumption.
content:
SINGAPORE (April 6): Singapore is restricting any supply and sale of mussels from Port Dickson, Malaysia, that are contaminated by biotoxins and are not safe for consumption.

Singapore Food Agency (SFA) said it has received confirmation from the Department of Fisheries (DOF) Malaysia on the matter and is working with importers to verify the source of their mussel imports and ensuring that they are not imported from the area.

The agency said it has not detected a

title: Zaiyadal buys major stake in halal ecosystem solutions specialist Serunai
summary: SHAH ALAM: Zaiyadal Sdn Bhd is acquiring a 35 per cent interest in Serunai Commerce Sdn Bhd, a move which will make it the largest shareholder in the company.Zaiyadal had on March 8 entered into a share subscription agreement with Serunai ...
content:
SHAH ALAM: Zaiyadal Sdn Bhd is acquiring a 35 per cent interest in Serunai Commerce Sdn Bhd, a move which will make it the largest shareholder in the company.

Zaiyadal had on March 8 entered into a share subscription agreement with Serunai for the acquisition. 

Zaiyadal group executive director Datuk Lukman Ibrahim said the strategic investment is driven by the company's vision to facilitate the assurance of Halal products.

This will also empower consumers worldwide to effortlessly verify the Halal status of an

title: Ringgit expected to trade in tight range of 4.72-4.73 versus US dollar next week
summary:
The ringgit is expected to trade in a tight range of RM4.72 to RM4.73 against the US dollar in the upcoming holiday-shortened week of trading, said an economist.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said Brent crude oil prices were hovering above US$90 per barrel amid concern over geopolitical risks in the Middle East.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 6): The ringgit is expected to trade in a tight range of RM4.72 to RM4.73 against the US dollar in the upcoming holiday-shortened week of trading, said an economist.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said Brent crude oil prices were hovering above US$90 per barrel amid concern over geopolitical risks in the Middle East.

He said the foreign exchange market is in defensive mode with demand for safe haven cur

title: The Week Ahead: Attention on monetary policy decisions in major economies
summary:
It will be a relatively quiet week on the local economic front as the holy month of Ramadan draws to a close and Muslims celebrate Hari Raya Aidilfitri, with April 10 and 11 being public holidays. Taking centre stage is the slew of monetary policy decisions in major economies due this week.

content:

It will be a relatively quiet week on the local economic front as the holy month of Ramadan draws to a close and Muslims celebrate Hari Raya Aidilfitri, with April 10 and 11 being public holidays. Taking centre stage is the slew of monetary policy decisions in major economies due this week.

title: More PLCs have stronger balance sheets than before pandemic
summary: The last few years saw multiple challenges that tested businesses’ financial resilience, from Covid-19 to the post-pandemic commodity and inflation shocks, which in turn spurred interest rate hikes that indirectly skewed global currency exchange trends.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 6): The last few years saw multiple challenges that tested businesses’ financial resilience, from Covid-19 to the post-pandemic commodity and inflation shocks, which in turn spurred interest rate hikes that indirectly skewed global currency exchange trends.

The surprising good news coming out of this unprecedented series of events is that there is a notable improvement in the balance sheets of Malaysian public listed companies (PLCs), judging by their debt and cash positions (net gearing or

title: SBH Marine expects a return to profitability
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: SBH Marine Holdings Bhd, poised for a robust return, anticipates a full revival of its aquaculture shrimp farming operations this year, foreseeing a return to profitability in this sector. The company also holds a positive outlook on its ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: SBH Marine Holdings Bhd, poised for a robust return, anticipates a full revival of its aquaculture shrimp farming operations this year, foreseeing a return to profitability in this sector. 

The company also holds a positive outlook on its future prospects on the anticipated expansion of the frozen seafood market.

Managing director Tan Boo Nam expressed confidence, citing various factors, including the decline in wild fisheries, escalating consumer health awareness, a burgeoning global population, and increas

title: Maxis rating upgraded to 'buy'
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: CIMB Securities Sdn Bhd says the concerns regarding Maxis Bhd's involvement in the 5G network rollout may be exaggerated.According to the research firm, Digital Nasional Bhd (DNB)'s wholesale charge in the 2024 fiscal year (FY24) would ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: CIMB Securities Sdn Bhd says the concerns regarding Maxis Bhd's involvement in the 5G network rollout may be exaggerated.

According to the research firm, Digital Nasional Bhd (DNB)'s wholesale charge in the 2024 fiscal year (FY24) would be lower than anticipated.

"Any investment in Entity B (the second 5G network operator) is unlikely to significantly impact Maxis's balance sheet," it said.

title: 'Buy' call retained on Focus Point
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Focus Point Holdings Bhd's development into the food and beverage (F&B) industry is expected to sustain its profitability in the future because of the consistent business volumes from its current corporate clients and in-house Komugi ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Focus Point Holdings Bhd's development into the food and beverage (F&B) industry is expected to sustain its profitability in the future because of the consistent business volumes from its current corporate clients and in-house Komugi outlets.

RHB Research said in a note that Focus Point staged an earnings turnaround in its F&B segment (16 per cent of FY23 sales) in the fourth quarter of 2023 (Q4 2023) after resolving the issue of over-manpower in its central kitchens. 

The company targets adding

title: Matta welcomes end to Puspakom monopoly
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The Malaysian Association of Tour and Travel Agents (MATTA) welcomed the termination of the PUSPAKOM monopoly as a critical step in revitalising the tourism sector.  MATTA emphasised that the sector has long struggled with inefficiencies in licensing tourism ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The Malaysian Association of Tour and Travel Agents (MATTA) welcomed the termination of the PUSPAKOM monopoly as a critical step in revitalising the tourism sector.

MATTA emphasised that the sector has long struggled with inefficiencies in licensing tourism cars, which has created serious difficulties and annoyance for operators.

It said that this milestone marks the beginning of a new age in transportation, promising several benefits for both stakeholders and customers.

In a statement, the assoc

title: HLIB research maintains 'buy' stance on Ambank
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: AMMB Holdings Bhd is expected to record notable quarter-on-quarter (QoQ) growth in its upcoming fourth quarter ending March 31, 2024 (Q4FY24) results, potentially returning to its quarterly run rate of RM400 million. Hong Leong Investment Bank (HLIB) Research said ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: AMMB Holdings Bhd is expected to record notable quarter-on-quarter (QoQ) growth in its upcoming fourth quarter ending March 31, 2024 (Q4FY24) results, potentially returning to its quarterly run rate of RM400 million. 

Hong Leong Investment Bank (HLIB) Research said despite Austalia's lender ANZ Group's share disposal overhang, the firm still views AmBank's risk-reward profile favourably.

title: Matrade invites firms to join Malaysia Pavillion
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's aerospace exports continues to show substantial growth, underscoring the country's significance in the global aerospace industry, according to the Malaysia External Trade Development Corporation (Matrade).Abu Bakar Yusof, the deputy chief executive officer of Matrade, ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's aerospace exports continues to show substantial growth, underscoring the country's significance in the global aerospace industry, according to the Malaysia External Trade Development Corporation (Matrade).

Abu Bakar Yusof, the deputy chief executive officer of Matrade, expressed optimism in Malaysia's aerospace sector, pointing to a notable 31 per cent increase in aerospace product exports in the first two months of 2024, which came to RM979.9 million compared to the corresponding period

content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Standard Chartered forecast that the ringgit will be at 4.66 against the US dollar by the end of the second quarter (Q2) and 4.58 by the end of 2024.

In a report, the company said that Malaysia's commodity and electronics trade surpluses are expected to improve, while high foreign currency deposits onshore should provide a positioning boost once markets get clarity on US Federal Reserve (Fed) policy easing.

title: Malaysia shows resilience and opportunities in attracting investments
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia has witnessed the emergence of numerous new plants, indicating the enduring resilience and opportunities within its industrial sector despite the post-pandemic closures of certain factories.Samuel Tan, executive director at KGV International Property Consultants, said the openings ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia has witnessed the emergence of numerous new plants, indicating the enduring resilience and opportunities within its industrial sector despite the post-pandemic closures of certain factories.

Samuel Tan, executive director at KGV International Property Consultants, said the openings symbolise elements crucial for economic recovery such as job creation and the potential adaptation of industries to evolving market demands and emerging technologies.

title: Wall St Week Ahead: US stocks' lofty valuations in spotlight
summary: The US stock market is the most expensive it has been in around two years. Its valuation could be put to the test as companies report earnings in coming weeks.
content:
Unremarkable earnings growth could give investors less reason to hold onto stocks, at a time when elevated yields on Treasuries bolster the attractiveness of bonds.

NEW YORK: The US stock market is the most expensive it has been in around two years. Its valuation could be put to the test as companies report earnings in coming weeks.

The S&P 500 is up more than 9% year-to-date, following its strongest

title: Oil prices climb over US$1 a barrel on supply risk
summary: The Brent and US West Texas Intermediate crude oil benchmarks rose more than US$1 a barrel during trade on Friday as markets watched for signs of any direct conflict between Israel and Iran that could further tighten supplies.
content:
Brent crude settled at US$91.17 a barrel, up 52 cents, or 0.57%. US West Texas Intermediate crude finished at US$86.91 a barrel, up 32 cents, or 0.37%.

HOUSTON: The Brent and US West Texas Intermediate crude oil benchmarks rose more than US$1 a barrel during trade on Friday as markets watched for signs of any direct conflict between Israel and Iran that could further tighten supplies.

title: Wall St indices rise after strong jobs data
summary: US stocks finished higher on Friday after a strong jobs report reinforced the view that the economy remains healthy even as it suggested the Federal Reserve could delay cutting interest rates.
content:
The Dow rose 307.06 points, or 0.80%, to 38,904.04, the S&P 500 gained 57.13 points, or 1.11%, to 5,204.34 and the Nasdaq gained 199.44 points, or 1.24%, to 16,248.52.

NEW YORK: US stocks finished higher on Friday after a strong jobs report reinforced the view that the economy remains healthy even as it suggested the Federal Reserve could delay cutting interest rates.

title: Chin Hin, Farm Fresh, UEM Edgenta, KLCCP, MMAG, TDM, Mah Sing, Haily, Fast Energy
summary: Here is a brief recap of some business news and corporate announcements that made the headlines on Friday
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 5): Here is a brief recap of some business news and corporate announcements that made the headlines on Friday:

Chin Hin Group Bhd has increased its stake in Chin Hin Group Property Bhd (CHGP) by 3.39% to 57.13% for RM29.26 million, buying 22.39 million shares at an average price of RM1.305 each between March 19 and April 4, 2024.The stake purchase in CHGP, which was entirely internally funded, is premised on CHGP’s prominent future earnings prospects and orderbook in the construction

title: Large-scale solar scene abuzz with activity again
summary: Finally the bidding process for the fifth cycle of the country’s large-scale solar (LSS5) programme has kicked off after a three-year hiatus.
content:
FINALLY the bidding process for the fifth cycle of the country’s large-scale solar (LSS5) programme has kicked off after a three-year hiatus.

A total of two gigawatts (GW) in capacity is up for grabs – more than double the capacity offered under the previous round of the LSS competitive-bidding process.

title: Minority shareholders need more protection
summary: The textbook definition of minority oppression refers to unfair treatment or behaviour by a corporation, likely controlled by a majority shareholder(s) or director(s) of a company that disregards the minority shareholders.
content:
There are no specific rules that define oppression but the test is really whether there is commercial unfairness in the treatment of a shareholder.

The textbook definition of minority oppression refers to unfair treatment or behaviour by a corporation, likely controlled by a majority shareholder(s) or director(s) of a company that disregards the minority shareholders.

In most cases, the acts carried out a

title: SWFs see mixed performance in challenging climate
summary: Sovereign wealth funds (SWFs) had a mixed financial year in 2023 (FY23) which saw the investment climate strained by geopolitical tensions, elevated inflation and higher interest rates, but also major equity market benchmarks at fresh highs.
content:
Liew: Given the nature of SWFs as typically not alpha seekers, their performance would be best rated on the stability of their financial investments.

SOVEREIGN wealth funds (SWFs) had a mixed financial year in 2023 (FY23) which saw the investment climate strained by geopolitical tensions, elevated inflation and higher interest rates, but also major equity market benchmarks at fresh highs.

summary: Bank Rakyat Group has recorded a higher profit before tax and zakat (PBTZ) of RM1.76bil for the financial year ended Dec 31, 2023 (FY23), an increase of 3.8% compared with RM1.7bil a year ago.
content:
The group attributed the higher profit to strong fundamentals.

content:
Eu Yan Sang operates over 170 retail outlets in China, Hong Kong, Macau, Malaysia and Singapore. — The Straits Times

SINGAPORE: Two Japanese firms are providing and outlay of US$594mil to buy out local traditional Chinese medicine maker Eu Yan Sang.

content:
The land, with a proposed development to be named M Tiara 2, is expected to have an estimated gross development value of RM1.45bil.

title: Solving a RM1.3 trillion pension liability problem
summary: When Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Ahmad Zahid Hamidi said in January that the government is scrapping the pension scheme for new civil servants as part of its pension reform plan, it was met with much resistance.
content:
WHEN Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Ahmad Zahid Hamidi said in January that the government is scrapping the pension scheme for new civil servants as part of its pension reform plan, it was met with much resistance.

For many civil servants, they do not mind the lower salaries as they are assured of a guaranteed pension when they retire. The pension system is considered to be lucrative, especially if they live to an old age.</

title: Responsibility over sustainability
summary: For some corporations, sustainability falls under the purview of their audit and risk committees because it is seen primarily as a reporting requirement.
content:
FOR some corporations, sustainability falls under the purview of their audit and risk committees because it is seen primarily as a reporting requirement.

But the ideal situation is that it should be embedded in the way an organisation operates and make it part of the daily objective of the teams.

title: ONE-STOP DIGITAL FINANCING MARKETPLACE FOR MSMES
summary: In today's digital-first world, financial technology (fintech) is poised to play a crucial role in empowering smaller businesses through different stages of growth.
content:

IN TODAY’S digital-first world, financial technology (fintech) is poised to play a crucial role in empowering smaller businesses through different stages of growth.
